response: I descended the stairs like a ghost, almost flying
context/0: I pressed my teeth to reinforce my only wish...his death
context/1: I heard someone in the stairs... and those same steps on the dry leafs of the park.
context/3: My mother sent it for protection.
context/4: I´m sorry.
context/5: Pray for him, for all of them
context/6: I won´t be able to sleep tonight.

context: One you're sure is on your side.
response: At least I chose a side.
context/0: Maybe you do need a man around here.
context/2: Cos you're sure gonna need it.
context/3: I sure wish you troopers luck.
context/4: Get your things inside the mission.
context/5: Now, get those horses unhitched and put them in the corral.
context/9: Miss Hannah, I appoint you sergeant and second-in-command.

context: Now, there.
response: Tell me, how much money you got?
context/3: Let me get down, will ya?
context/4: We find out
context/5: All I want is to get outta here!
context/9: What are you gonna do to me?

context: So, good bye everybody, and remember please, for the next day or so, the terrible lesson you learned tonight.
response: That grinning, glowing, globular invader of your living room is an inhabitant of the pumpkin patch.
context/0: Now, you will be relieved, I hope, to learn that we didn't mean it and that both institutions are still open for business.
context/1: We annihilated the world before your very ears and utterly destroyed the Columbia Broadcasting System.
context/2: Starting now, we couldn't soap all your windows and steal all your garden gates by tomorrow night, so we did the next best thing.
context/4: The Mercury Theatre's own radio version of dressing up in a sheet and jumping out of a bush and saying, boo!
context/5: This is your host, ladies and gentlemen, out of character to assure you that "The War Of The Worlds" has no further significance than as the holiday offering it was intended to be.
context/8: It oughtta be on every station in the world.

context: I know why you're here.
context/0: This is Mr. Davenport's secretary, Miss Rita Norge.
context/4: He's not dead.
context/5: Taking charge of Edward Davenport's affairs for his widow.
context/8: My name is Mason and I'm an attorney.

context: Very quiet, dependable sort of fellow.
context/0: Lived next door to him for five years now.
context/1: Did you know him at all well?
context/2: Say, what kind of a chap was he?
context/3: Me and the missus was in the back, you see, having our tea.
context/4: No, not a thing.
context/5: Nothing at all, eh?
context/8: Did you hear him come home or go into his house?
context/9: Well, you didn't hear anything at all in here?
